Site Response Organization 
All response action is coordinated by the Chemours Site Incident Commander.  The Chemours Shift Team Leaders are trained and certified to fill this role. There is one Chemours Shift Team Leader onsite at all times.  
 
The Chemours Incident Commanders can be contacted by calling:

68.155 (f) PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

PureTech strives to upgrade its processes, control technology, employee training, and inspection, repair and maintenance of process equipment in order to improve safety. As part of the PureTech process hazards review program, all processes are thoroughly reviewed on a specific periodic basis to identify risk reduction opportunities to improve safety. As a result of these reviews, several items have been implemented or are in the process of being implemented to enhance our process safety management, such as:
* Implementation of additional safety interlocks 
* Replacement of pressure vessels with an inherently safer design.

Executive Summary
PureTech Scientific Inc. Risk Management Plan
(40 CFR 68, EPA Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions)
EPA Facility ID: 1000 0025 1737

PureTech Scientific LLC. (PureTech) acquired the Glycolic Acid Plant from The Chemours Company on August 1, 2023. The Glycolic Acid Plant was an existing plant located within The Chemours Company - Belle, West Virginia manufacturing complex, previously owned and operated by Chemours. The following provides a high-level summary of PureTechs Risk Management Plan (RMP).

68.155 (a) ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

PureTech is committed to protect our employees and the communities that are home to our operations, which are an integral part of PureTechs way of doing business. The PureTech  Glycolic Acid Plant is committed to operating and maintaining all processes in a safe and responsible manner, as our top priority every day is the health and safety of our employees, near neighbors, the community, and the environment.

PureTech adheres to company policies embodied in numerous environmental, health and safety standards, as well as engineering standards. This documentation is available to all PureTech employees. Included in these standards are the requirements on Process Safety Management (PSM), under OSHA.

68.155 (b) THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

The PureTech Glycolic Acid Plant is a continuous manufacturing operation that produces crude glycolic acid from formaldehyde. The manufacturing process includes one regulated substance listed in the RMP regulations, which is formaldehyde.

Plant property, where regulated substances are handled and processed, is secured by fence and manned by security personnel at all times.
